Improve teardown skipping

Replace run-teardown-on-result-mismatch with smart-teardown, which
skips teardown in case control and test queries succeeds but
verification fails.

This allows result tables to be perserved in cases like checksum
query failures, to ease debugging and investigation.

inset, fails but the table was still created. Therefore, in case

resubmit the verification to mitigate the transient error.

timeline.bodyText:
It's strange to me that this class is mutable and gets passed around and modified in several places.  Usually we try to limit the use of mutable objects in Presto, especially across different classes.  In my opinion the mutability here makes the lifecycle of each object confusing and makes the code more error prone (e.g. trying to update the same field 2x). The second commit seems like it's fixing a problem that's mostly caused by this being a mutable object.  And then later commits add even more things to this class, which I think just makes it more fragile. I think it would be better to break this class up into a few classes that can each be immutable.
For example, you can separate out an object for keeping the data verification info of control and test checksum queries and build that in DataVerfication.verify(), and then have another object that has all the determinism info that.gets built in the DeterminismAnalyzer and have the LimitDeterminismAnalysis also return the queryId, so that part can be immutable to.
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText:
@rschlussel Comments addressed.
Instead of expanding the mutable object VerificationContext, changes were made to make it immutable. Separate checksum-related mutable fields into CheckQueryContext, and use DeterminismAnalysisDetails.Builder to replace determinism analysis related mutable fields.
replies.author: caithagoras

timeline.message:
Restart verification if checksum queries fail with table already exists

Setup queries create the target tables for INSERT verification.
We're seeing setup queries failing but the table was still created.
Therefore, in case checksum queries fail due to table already exists
error, we can resubmit the verification to mitigate the transient
error.

timeline.bodyText: I don't feel the toOptional change helps with readability. Optional.of()/Optional.ofNullable() is already pretty succinct, used frequently throughout the code base, and it's obvious what they do.  The helper function is slightly shorter, but then I need to spend time figuring out if there's custom logic as part of toOptional.
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: What's the purpose of using AtomicReferences?
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText:
In 141 - 150, those variables are used in lambda, and IntelliJ complains about "Variable used in lambda expression should be final or effectively final" if they're nullable or Optional.
Instead, I need a reference to those variables, with setter method for updating the value. AtomicReference seems to be easiest to use although I don't need the atomicity of the update. Otherwise, I'll need create a private static inner class Reference.
replies.author: caithagoras

replies.bodyText: That seems sketchy to me, but I can't tell if it's actually a problem here or just seems bad (https://www.baeldung.com/java-lambda-effectively-final-local-variables is what I read to understand what the problems might be).  I feel it would be better to change it because my general philosophy is it's best if a reader doesn't have to think too hard to understand why code is correct.  However, you could alternatively get a review from someone with deeper Java knowledge to say whether there are any concerns in this case, and then also add a comment about why these use AtomicReference and why it's not a problem.
replies.author: rschlussel
mbasmanova

replies.bodyText:
@mbasmanova
Copy would work only for variables to be read, but I also need values to be set in the the lambda.
controlStats::set,
e -> controlState.set(getFailingQueryState(e))
controlStats and controlState are used as a 1-field mutable context object.
It is similar to creating a private mutable Context object wrapping all those field, define setters on each of them, and supply context::setControlStats and e->context.setControlState(getFailingQueryState(e)).
replies.author: caithagoras

replies.bodyText: @caithagoras Thanks for clarifying. I like the solution using Context object better.
replies.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: Done. Since @rschlussel advices against mutable classes, I'm making the mutable context a private static inner class to minimize exposure.
replies.author: caithagoras

timeline.bodyText: Does this test that covers the case that was failing before?  Or if not, is there a test that does?
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: No it does not, but I manually tested it. Adding that test a bit more complex, and I add a TODO here. Can we proceed with the PR so that we can use it for 0.234 verification? I'll add the test shortly. Thanks!
replies.author: caithagoras

timeline.message:
Restart verification if checksum queries fail with table already exists

Setup queries create the target tables for INSERT verification.
We're seeing setup queries failing but the table was still created.
Therefore, in case checksum queries fail due to table already exists
error, we can resubmit the verification to mitigate the transient
error.

Improve VerificationContext

- Remove determinismAnalysisDetails from VerificationContext. Use
  the builder directly.
- Move check query info to a separate class.
- Use Optional fields instead of nullable fields.
- Move getters and setters of DeterminismAnalysisDetails fields into
  a builder.

Restart verification if checksum queries fail with table already exists

Setup queries create the target tables for INSERT verification.
We're seeing setup queries failing but the table was still created.
Therefore, in case checksum queries fail due to table already exists
error, we can resubmit the verification to mitigate the transient
error.

Fix verification resubmission

VerificationContext contains fields that can be set only once. When
verification is resubmitted, Verification#run method is called again
on the same object, and in turn, the setters will be called again
in the new run and throws, potentially causing resubmission to fail.

Break the circular dependency between DataVerification and
VerificationManager by performing the actual resubmission in
VerificationManager.

Add resubmission count to VerificationContext, each Verification
maintains its resubmission count instead of requiring
VerificationManager to keep track.

Also, export the resubmission count in the output event.

Restart verification if checksum queries fail with table already exists

Setup queries create the target tables for INSERT verification.
We're seeing setup queries failing but the table was still created.
Therefore, in case checksum queries fail due to table already exists
error, we can resubmit the verification to mitigate the transient
error.

Improve readability in AbstractVerification

Remove the nullable variables.
Remove FAILED_TO_TEARDOWN from QueryState since it is a impossible
state.

Expose unexpected exceptions in Verifier

Previously, Verifier silently ignores exceptions that are not
QueryException, as they're only loggged but not VerifierQueryEvent
is exported.

Handle general exception properly so that they can be uncovered and
investigated. Mark them as SKIPPED so that they do cause noise.

Fix AbstractTestVerifierIntegrationSmokeTest

The test merely tests injection and continue to succeed even when
there are verification failures. Add assertions that the testing
verification are succeded.

Also, add missing configuration properties that caused verifications
in the integration test to fail.

Improve teardown skipping

Replace run-teardown-on-result-mismatch with smart-teardown, which
skips teardown in case control and test queries succeeds but
verification fails.

This allows result tables to be perserved in cases like checksum
query failures, to ease debugging and investigation.

error, we can resubmit the verification to mitigate the transient
error.
